intro: Macrosamanea basijuga, commonly known as the giant arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large,戟-shaped leaves and can grow up to several meters in height. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. Its rhizomes are edible and have a starchy texture similar to taro. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland rainforests.
